newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Cetes rate pares advance on firm peso.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Cetes rate pares advance on firm peso.

text.p: Mexican overnight Cetes rates pared their initial rise to close up 25 basis points at 18.25 percent on Thursday after the peso reversed early weakness to close firmer, traders said.
"The market opened under pressure, which eased considerably after trade balance data were released," a fixed-income analyst said.
"The peso, which had been sold off, was then in demand and that boosted market liquidity," he added.
Benchmark 48-hour peso contracts closed 1.8 centavos firmer at 7.9060/7.9110 per dollar.
The Finance Ministry revised March's trade surplus to $636 million, up from a preliminary figure of $565 million.
Overnight Cetes rates had opened up at 19.25 percent.
Banco de Mexico drained 1.214 billion pesos from the secondary market by placing three direct sales of Cetes and two repos.
Overnight rates on bank paper meanwhile ended down 20 basis points at 19.75 percent.
Dealers said secondary rates could ease further on Friday in response to milder than expected inflation data released in late trade.
Banco de Mexico announced the consumer price index increased by 1.08 percent, compared to an average forecast of 1.11 percent in a previously conducted Reuters survey MEX22.
Liquidity of 176 million pesos was scheduled to return to the system on Friday from prior central bank participation.
